page.title: 04ESTATES IN THE RIB VALLEY.
page.content: Apart from Youngsbury,there are several other estates in this area. {"SUTES"}lies to the north of High Cross village. It used to be called "Soos" and the first record of it,was in 1412. The present house is a C17th timber-frame house,now covered with plaster. 2 original chimney stacks and the kitchen fireplace remain. It used to be a moated manor house. {"SAWTREES"}manor was first owned by Sir Nicholas Thorley(knight) in C15th. {"GREAT BARWICK"}manor was first owned by Eustace Fitz-Thomas in C13th. It was leased by the king to Sir Ralph Sadleir,in 1543. {"FABDENS"}is a good example of a "Wealden" house ie. it has one ridge running the whole length of the house. {"MARSHALLS"}manor at High Cross is an old site,but the original house was replaced by a new building in 1906.
